file_insights.changes_summary: Added responsive design patterns throughout the ProjectsPage component using Material-UI's sx prop with responsive values
key_modifications: Padding responsive: p: 3 → p: { xs: 2, sm: 3 }
Grid layouts made responsive: repeat(4, 1fr) → { xs: 'repeat(2, 1fr)', md: 'repeat(4, 1fr)' }
Button text responsive: 'New Project' text hidden on mobile, 'New' shown instead using display breakpoints
Filter button replaced with IconButton on mobile using conditional display
Flex direction responsive: row on desktop, column on mobile
SearchField now flex: 1 for full width on mobile
Form inputs responsive: gridTemplateColumns { xs: '1fr', sm: '1fr 1fr' } for date fields
file_insights.impact: High - affects user experience across all device sizes

patterns_discovered.description: Consistent use of Material-UI breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg) for responsive behavior
examples: display: { xs: 'none', sm: 'inline' } for conditional rendering via CSS

patterns_discovered.description: Strategic hiding/swapping of UI elements based on screen size to improve mobile UX
examples: Button text 'New Project' hidden on mobile, replaced with 'New'
Filter button hidden on mobile, replaced with IconButton
Flex layout changes from row (desktop) to column (mobile)
patterns_discovered.effectiveness: High - reduces visual clutter on small screens

patterns_discovered.description: Dynamic spacing (gap, padding) and alignment (justifyContent, alignItems) based on viewport
examples: gap: 2 remains constant but parent flex direction changes
patterns_discovered.effectiveness: Medium - improves visual balance but adds complexity

gotchas_discovered.description: Multiple nested sx prop objects with responsive values can become difficult to read and maintain
gotchas_discovered.example: flexDirection: { xs: 'column', md: 'row' } with justifyContent, alignItems, gap all having separate responsive specs
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Consider extracting complex responsive styles into separate styled components or sx helper objects

gotchas_discovered.description: Button text 'New Project' is hidden on mobile with display: { xs: 'none', sm: 'inline' }, but no overflow text handling for remaining elements
gotchas_discovered.example: Filter and other text elements may still overflow on very small screens
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Consider adding ellipsis or abbreviations for remaining text on xs screens

gotchas_discovered.description: Different grids use different breakpoint strategies (xs/md vs xs/sm/lg), creating inconsistency
gotchas_discovered.example: Skeleton grid uses { xs: 'repeat(2, 1fr)', md: 'repeat(4, 1fr)' } while projects grid uses { xs: '1fr', sm: 'repeat(2, 1fr)', lg: 'repeat(3, 1fr)' }
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Standardize breakpoint strategy across all grids for consistency

approach_outcome.task: Update ProjectsPage with responsive grid and mobile-friendly cards
approach_outcome.methodology: Incremental responsive design implementation using Material-UI's sx prop with responsive value objects
key_achievements: Successfully implemented responsive padding and spacing across all container elements
Created mobile-optimized button layouts with conditional text display
Converted fixed-column grids to responsive grids with appropriate breakpoints
Added mobile-specific UI controls (IconButton for filters) alongside desktop versions
Made form layouts responsive with proper column spanning on different screen sizes
approach_outcome.execution_quality: High - all changes follow Material-UI best practices and maintain code consistency
approach_outcome.testing_recommendations: Verify layout behavior at xs (320px), sm (600px), md (960px), and lg (1280px) breakpoints

recommendations.suggestion: Extract complex responsive sx objects into reusable theme-based variants
recommendations.rationale: Multiple complex responsive objects reduce readability and make future updates harder

recommendations.suggestion: Standardize breakpoint usage across all grid components (currently using xs/md and xs/sm/lg)
recommendations.rationale: Inconsistent breakpoints may cause uneven responsive behavior across the page

recommendations.suggestion: Add text truncation and ellipsis handling for buttons and labels on xs screens
recommendations.rationale: Very small screens (320px) may still experience text overflow issues

recommendations.suggestion: Create responsive design test cases covering all breakpoints (xs, sm, md, lg)
recommendations.rationale: Ensures consistent layout behavior across device sizes

recommendations.suggestion: Document the responsive breakpoint strategy used in ProjectsPage for team consistency
recommendations.rationale: Helps other developers maintain consistent responsive patterns in future updates
